From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To perform a test of Multibus memory (including nonvolatile memory) on the modular router, use the **testÂ memory** command in privileged EXEC mode. The memory test overwrites memory.

ParaDef.Info: This commmand has no arguments or keywords.

Examples: In the following example, the memory is tested:
ExtraInfo: The memory test overwrites memory. If you use the **test memory** command, you will need to rewrite nonvolatile memory. For example, if you test Multibus memory, which is the memory used by the CSC-R 4-Mbps Token Ring interfaces, you will need to reload the system before the network interfaces will operate properly. The **test memory** command is intended primarily for use by Cisco personnel.

RelatedCmds.description: Tests Flash memory on MCI and envm Flash EPROM interfaces.
Tests the system interfaces on the modular router.
